snippet: President Nicolás Maduro and a coalition of opposition leaders met at the presidential palace in Caracas in a televised conference aimed at bridging a bitter political divide.
abstract: Venezuelan Pres Nicolas Maduro and coalition of opposition leaders meet at the presidential palace in Caracas for televised conference aimed at easing tensions that have escalated during more than two months of antigovernment protests, which have cost at least 40 lives.

byline.contributor: María Eugenia Díaz and Catalina Lobo-Guerrero contributed reporting from Caracas, Venezuela.

lead_paragraph: President Nicolás Maduro and a coalition of opposition leaders met at the presidential palace in Caracas in a televised conference aimed at bridging a bitter political divide.

headline.main: Venezuelan Leader and Opposition Meet in Bid to Ease Tensions
headline.print_headline: Venezuelan Leader and Opposition Meet, Trying to Ease Tension
